snippet: New York State officials want the Defense Department to help clean up the pollution caused by firefighting foam that contains a dangerous chemical....
abstract: New York State's Environmental Conservation Dept demands help from United States Defense Dept in paying for cleanup at Stewart Air National Guard Base after its designation as state Superfund site; state environmental officials say federal base used firefighting foam containing  perfluorooctanesulfonic acid, which has been leaked to cancer, and that chemical polluted tributary leading to Lake Washington, source of drinking water for town of Newburgh.
lead_paragraph: New York State officials want the Defense Department to help clean up the pollution caused by firefighting foam that contains a dangerous chemical.

headline.main: Military Base Near Newburgh Is Made a Superfund Site Over Tainted Water
headline.print_headline: State Demands  Defense Dept.  Help Clean Up  Tainted Water

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
